hours_text:
# Hours & Tickets

**Sunday** | **Select Museums:** Open: Noon-4:00  
---|---  
**Monday** | CLOSED  
**Tuesday** | Open: 10:00-4:00  
**Wednesday** | Open: 10:00-4:00  
**Thursday** | Open: 10:00-4:00  
**Friday** | Open: 10:00-4:00  
**Saturday** | Open: 10:00-4:00  
  
**Sunday Museums:** The Pensacola Museum of History, the Pensacola Children's Museum, and the Pensacola Museum of Art are open on Sundays from Noon to 4:00 with two ticketing options: a full 7 day ticket or a Sunday only ticket. To purchase [online admission](https://ecom.roller.app/uwfhistorictrust/sundayonlineadmission/en-us/home) for the Sunday one-day-half-price ticket,**use discount code: ONSUNHALF.**

**Admission:** Provides entrance to the [Pensacola Museum of Art](https://www.pensacolamuseum.org/), the [Pensacola Museum of History](/plan-your-visit/museums-properties/pensacola-museum-of-history/), the [Pensacola Children's Museum](/plan-your-visit/museums-properties/pensacola-childrens-museum/), and the museums of Historic Pensacola Village for seven (7) days from the date of presentation at a service desk. Tickets may be purchased [online](https://ecom.roller.app/uwfhistorictrust/admissiontickets/en-us/home) or at one of our service desks in the Tivoli High House Shop, the Pensacola Children's Museum, the Pensacola Museum of History, or the Pensacola Museum of Art. Included with admission are our [guided Historic House Tours](/plan-your-visit/tours-/) now at 11:00, 1:00, and 2:00 Tuesday through Sat...
accessibility_text:
# Accessibility

Wheelchair accessibility in some of our historic houses is limited due to door sizes, door thresholds, stairs, and other obstacles. A number of the historic houses have been modified to accommodate accessibility needs, and the UWF Historic Trust works hard to continually update all of the facilities. However, there are a few historic houses that are unable to be made fully accessible, as the necessary changes will significantly alter the buildings. If you need a wheelchair, one is available for use at the [Pensacola Museum of History](/plan-your-visit/museums-properties/pensacola-museum-of-history/).

The buildings that are wheelchair accessible and that have accessible bathrooms include: the [Pensacola Museum of History](/plan-your-visit/museums-properties/pensacola-museum-of-history/), the [Voices of Pensacola](/plan-your-visit/museums-properties/voices-of-pensacola/), the [Pensacola Children’s Museum](/plan-your-visit/museums-properties/pensacola-childrens-museum/), the [Museum of Commerce](/plan-your-visit/museums-properties/museum-of-commerce/), the [Museum of Industry](/plan-your-visit/museums-properties/museum-of-industry/), [Old Christ Church](/plan-your-visit/museums-properties/old-christ-church/), the L & N Marine Terminal, and the Bowden Building.

There are a number of designated handicapped parking spaces located in visitor parking lots and available in select on­street parking areas.

Please contact the UWF Historic Trust ([850.595.5985](tel:850...
collections_text:
# Voices of Pensacola

[117 E Government St, Pensacola, FL 32502](https://www.google.com/maps/place/117+E+Government+St,+Pensacola,+FL+32502/@30.409251,-87.2151121,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x8890c0ad9c37a2bf:0xe14184de929f242!8m2!3d30.409251!4d-87.2129234)

Monday | **Closed**  
---|---  
Tuesday | 10:00-4:00  
Wednesday | 10:00-4:00  
Thursday | 10:00-4:00  
Friday | 10:00-4:00  
Saturday | **Closed**  
Sunday | **Closed**  
  
The first floor of the Voices of Pensacola includes a meeting space and theater.

#### _**On Display:**_

**_Musically Inclined: A Look at the Pensacola Jazz Scene_**

This exhibit highlights the history and influence of jazz music along the Gulf Coast.

#### _**Past Exhibits:**_

_**Black Citizenship in the Age of Jim Crow**_ is a traveling exhibit from the New-York Historical Society Museum & Library. The exhibit is now on display at Artel Gallery. To learn more about the exhibit visit the [African American Heritage Society](https://africanamericanheritagesociety.org/).

**_Travel Diaries: Stories from the Jane Peaden Collection_**

This exhibit highlights items from the Jane Peaden Collection, which is a large collection of items picked up during Jane’s travels in the 1970s and 1980s. Items are paired with images and diary entries that show how anyone can travel, broaden their horizons, and interact with communities across the globe. 

**_Lost Pensacola_**
